comments.body:
After working through the quickstart/running MLflow code on their laptops etc, users will end up at this section, which renders like:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2358483/64822185-49ec0e00-d569-11e9-9bc3-ac0797133398.png)
Does the path not have to include "/Users/[username]"?

^Not on CE at least (you can log to the root workspace directory), but on typical Databricks deployments you don't have permissions to do that, so the /Users/username is required. I was thinking about telling people to use `/Users/username` on CE too, but left that out here so that the snippet works as is without modification.

diffHunk:

- :ref:`Launch a tracking server <tracking_server>` on a remote machine.

- Alternatively, sign up for `Databricks Community Edition <https://databricks.com/try-databricks>`_,

comments.body: This should be at the end of the quick start; focus the quick start on how to run it locally so people don't have to set up an account.
